page.title: 01ARNISH - NORTH RAASAY
page.content: THIS BLOCK IS SITUATED AT THE NORTH END OF THE ISLAND OF RAASAY.IT HAS SEA ON ITS WEST, NORTH AND EAST SHORES IN THE BLOCK.THE LAND IS MAINLY HEATH AND MOORLAND WITH SOME WOODLAND MOSTLY SCRUB BIRCH AND HAZEL.THERE IS AN OLD RUINED CASTLE ON THE EAST SIDE. IT IS CALLED BROCHEL CASTLE.BELOW THE CASTLE A LOCAL MAN FROM THE SOUTH END OF RAASAY FISHES FOR SALMON. THERE ARE NOT MANY PEOPLE LIVING AT THE NORTH END OF THE ISLE OF RAASAY NOW.SEVERAL YEARS AGO THERE WERE MORE PEOPLE.THERE IS AN OLD SCHOOL THERE AND SOME OLD HOUSES WHICH NO ONE LIVES IN.SOMETIMES PEOPLE DO STAY IN THESE HOUSES AS THEY BELONG TO PEOPLE WHO ARE NOT PERMENANT RESIDENTS OF RAASAY. THERE ARE 2 FAMILIES LIVING IN ARNISH ALL THE TIME.
